body: I would suggest a better solution. Let's create a new class `RtValuePagination`, which will do what you want. And `RtPagination` will use `RtValuePagination` in order to allow others to use `JsonObject`. Makes sense?

This is the same solution that I've meant.
RtPagination  still has to be refactored: it could extend RtValuePagination class and the latter class should contain all logic that is inside RtPagination at the moment.
RtPagination should just extend RtValuePagination with JsonObject as a parameter for RtValuePagination.
Such approach allows to use RtPagination  in the same way as it used now. And this is preferable way to do it.
@yegor256 yes, will do. @den-anisimov thank you for this ticket, your account was topped up for 15 mins, transaction ID: `DA2118277`
@longtimeago This task is yours, please go ahead keeping in mind [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles). If any questions, don't hesitate to ask right here
@longtimeago This task's budget is **30 mins**. This is exactly how much will be paid when the problem explained above is solved. See [this](http://www.tpc2.com/dev/principles) for more information

issue.title: Issue #220

repository.name: jcabi-github
repository.description: Java Object-Oriented Wrapper of GitHub API, with a fake implementation of the entire GitHub API (for your tests)

issue.body: Pull request for an issue #220. It turned out more complicated, than I thought. @yegor256 can you help me to simplify it? Should I move a `SearchRequest` declaration to another file? There are no repository coordinates in a response to issues search (http://developer.github.com/v3/search/#search-issues), therefore I extracted it from issue's url (see `RtSearch.java:134`). Is this ok? And there were wrong line separators again.

body: @yegor256 let's try to merge again. We had a problem because someone pushed changes before me with old Pagination (with one parameter in Mapping) in RtPublicKeys
@den-anisimov Please, close the issue. Thank you!
